title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'default value' field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted and incorrectly stored in the report design. The following incorrect definition appears in the report design:<parameters><scalarParameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarParameter></parameters> There are two problems here:
OB: When entering an invalid date string in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted and stored incorrectly in the report design.
EB: The date value should be validated by either the user interface or the model, and an error should be displayed when an invalid date string is entered.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid date value is accepted and stored incorrectly in the report design.
5. Repeat the above steps, but enter a valid date string in the 'default value' field.
6. Verify that the valid date value is accepted and stored correctly in the report design.
